chargeHist.descr: Theft of Mail (30 or more pieces of mail)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Theft of Mail (30 or more pieces of mail)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Fredrick Eugene Robb Jr.  Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb in court by video with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal who appears in person.  Nicolas Heitman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Detective B. Wallander. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb in court, appear by video. Nicolas Heitman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing, State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/29/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Fredrick Eugene Robb in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@01:00
